title: Active Citizen Grant
description: The Active Citizen Grant encourages ground-up initiatives through innovating and organising activities in any of the following three domains: sports volunteerism, physical activity or health & wellness initiatives.

title: Asia-Ready Exposure Programme (AEP)
description: Supports projects that provide youth with industry and cultural exposure to ASEAN member states, China and India, up to $1,000 per eligible youth.

title: Charities Capability Fund (CCF)
description: Supports exempt/registered charities and Institutions of a Public Character to enhance governance/management capabilities and operational efficiency.

title: Charities Capability Fund (CCF) - Training Grant
description: The CCF Training Grant supports training courses (local classroom-based courses and local/overseas online courses) for charities' board members and staff (who have served in the charities for at least 6 months with an official designation) in key governance and management areas.

title: Coach Development Grant
description: The Coach Development Grant (CDG) provides financial assistance to individual sports coaches and coach developers who wish to upgrade their coaching knowledge and skills.

title: Communities of Care Grant
description: The Communities of Care Grant (COC) provides grant funding/support to individuals and organisations who wish to run a sports programme to benefit underserved and vulnerable populations in Singapore.

title: Community Capability Trust (CCT)
description: CCT is dedicated to strengthening Social Service Agencies (SSAs) through sustainable use of resources, to deliver better service outcomes.

title: Community Care Manpower Development Award (CCMDA)
description: CCMDA caters for entry and advanced skills training in a range of clinical and non-clinical areas for both in-service and fresh entrants. Its Visiting Expert scheme also funds the invitation of a local or overseas expert to visit your organisation for training.

title: Community Care Nursing Leadership Programme (CCNLP)
description: The Community Care Nursing Leadership Programme (CCNLP) aims to ensure the continuity of nursing leadership and facilitate the succession planning of nursing leaders in the Community Care sector.

title: Community Integration Fund
description: The CIF supports ground-up projects which create more opportunities for locals and foreigners to interact, and to help newcomers adapt to Singapore society.

title: Employment Facilitation – Manpower Recruitment and Training Initiatives (FY22-FY26)
description: The Employment Facilitation - Manpower Recruitment and Training Initiatives (EF-MRTI) is introduced to attract, train, and retain local support care staff in the Community Care sector and to recognise Community Care Organisations (CCOs) for their efforts and investment in the attraction and retention of locals.

title: Enhanced Fund-raising Programme
description: Supports organisations in efforts to raise funds and better meet the needs of the underserved in society.

title: Enterprise Innovation and Capability Development Grant (InnoGrant)
description: InnoGrant seeks innovative technological solutions to revolutionise sport and fitness experiences.

title: General Project Grant
description: Supports projects that align with Tote Board's funding principles and strategic outcomes with direct funding.

title: HARMONY FUND (HF)
description: The Harmony Fund supports creative projects that promote racial and religious harmony in Singapore.

title: Integrated Community Care Provider (ICCP) Phase 1 and 2
description: The Funding for Integrated Community Care Provider (ICCP) Year 1 and 2 is provided to each sub-region to form partnerships and practice service and care coordination.

title: Lively Places Fund
description: Interested to start a project to enliven Singapore's public space? Find out if you are eligible to apply for the Lively Places Fund.

title: Love Our ’Hood Fund
description: The Love Our ’Hood Fund supports projects that address municipal issues and/or foster a sense of community within the neighbourhood to manage neighbourly issues amicably.

title: Market and Audience Development
description: This grant supports your activities to build audiences, patrons and supporters that complement artistic efforts at home and abroad.

title: NYF (Research Grant)
description: The National Youth Fund (NYF) Research Grant provides funding for projects that deepen the understanding of salient youth issues or trends.

title: OUR SINGAPORE FUND (Community)
description: Have an idea for projects that bring communities together, that promotes Singapore's national identity and shared values? Find out if you are eligible to apply for Our Singapore Fund.

title: Pay-It-Forward Award
description: Each conferred Youth Corps leader is awarded $3,000 project grant to initiate and sustain ground-up initiatives to serve the local community.

title: Presentation & Participation
description: Supports the presentation of arts activities and works that express and enrich our artistic diversity, as well as increase arts appreciation and participation in Singapore.

title: Presentation & Participation (Publishing)
description: Supports professional book publishers or authors, who are committed to advancing the literary arts in Singapore, for the publication of original and translated works.

title: Productivity and Digitalisation Grant (PDG)
description: PDG supports the sector’s needs by focusing on 5 strategic areas, while promoting productivity and digitalisation.

title: Professional Capability Grant (Closed Grant Call)
description: This category focuses on courses that seeks to attract talents to join the social service sector, which includes Mid-Career Conversion courses and Social Service Tribe Study Award. It also funds courses to empower the social service leaders, at different skills level.

title: Professional Capability Grant (Open Grant Call)
description: This category focuses on courses that will develop and retain talents in the social service sector, which includes short to mid-term local and overseas training courses as well as clinical supervision that will build the manpower capability of the SSAs. It also funds social service projects aimed at improving staff competencies and the Sabbatical Leave Scheme (SLS) that focuses on staff wellness.

title: Programme X Fund
description: Programme X Fundings supports youth-initiated projects, enabling young changemakers to drive positive change in the Singapore community and society.

title: SG60 Towards Sustainability Fund
description: Explore funding for social service agencies (SSAs) to kickstart their capabilities in measuring, monitoring, and reporting the effectiveness of their programmes.

title: SUSTAIN THE ARTS (stART) FUND (ORGANISATION FUNDING)
description: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is an initiative by the National Arts Council (NAC), supported by the private sector to boost the long-term sustainability of small arts organisations, and to nurture a culture of giving to the arts.

title: SUSTAIN THE ARTS (stART) FUND (PROGRAMME FUNDING)
description: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is an initiative by the National Arts Council (NAC), supported by the private sector to boost the long-term sustainability of small arts organisations, and to nurture a culture of giving to the arts.

title: The Capability Development Grant
description: The Capability Development Grant (CD Grant) supports the continuous professional development of the people that work in Singapore’s arts and culture sector.

title: Tote Board Arts Fund
description: The Tote Board Arts Fund provides support to local artists/arts groups in bringing the arts to communities for people to connect with one another.

title: Tote Board Better Health Fund (TBBHF)
description: The Tote Board Better Health Fund (TBBHF) is a seed fund to pilot innovative programmes with a potential to scale within the community care sector.

title: WECARE ARTS FUND (WCAF)
description: Supports Social Service Agencies (SSAs) in engaging their beneficieries through the arts, to increase arts access within the social service sector.

title: YOUNG CHANGEMAKERS (YCM)
description: Have a cool idea that can contribute to the community? The Young ChangeMakers Grant supports youth-initiated projects that benefit the Singapore community and society.

title: Youth Corps Affiliate Project Grant (YCAF)
description: The Youth Corps Affiliate Project Grant supports Affiliate-initiated projects that drive a positive impact within the local community.

title: Youth Corps Aspirant Project (YCAP)
description: The Youth Corps Aspirant Project (YCAP) Grant is open to all aspirant project teams in the Youth Corps Leaders Programme.

title: Youth Corps Cluster Project Grant (YCCL)
description: The Youth Corps Cluster Project Grant supports Cluster-initiated projects that drive a positive impact within the local community.

title: Youth Corps Expedition Project
description: Supports youths embarking on Service-Learning projects involving communities in Asia, with a focus on the ASEAN member states, China and India.

title: Youth Expedition Project Goes Online (YEP-GO)
description: YEP-GO is a platform for youths to continue volunteering with the overseas communities without travel. Youths can connect with overseas partner organisations to develop programmes through virtual means.
